business.headline: Sensex closes 346 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Airtel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 345.80 points to end at 83,190.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 120.85 points to close at 25,355.25.

Dubai dreams under scanner as ED questions homebuyers: ReportMany of the individuals who bought property in Dubai are now under scrutiny as they failed to provide proper bank transaction records showing how the payments were made.

8th Pay Commission may hike salaries by 30–34%: ReportThe 8th Pay Commission could benefit around 11 million people, including about 4.4 million central government employees and nearly 6.8 million pensioners. Once approved, the changes will raise their basic pay, allowances, and retirement benefits.

Will ITR filing deadline be extended again? Here's why it mightIn May, the CBDT announced extending the ITR filing deadline, citing big changes in the forms and system readiness. It said that the updated ITRs will make compliance simpler and reporting more transparent for taxpayers.

Zepto, Blinkit, Instamart face a new rival in Delhi's 10-min delivery warThe move brings the e-commerce giant into direct competition with local players such as Blinkit (owned by Eternal), Swiggy Instamart and Zepto, who already dominate the quick delivery space.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe?The bidding window for the IPO will remain open until Monday, July 14. Investors can place bids within the price band of Rs 387 to Rs 407 per share.

When nursery fees need an EMI: CoinSwitch co-founder flags new middle-class crisisOnce believed to be the key to a better life, schooling today has ironically become the heaviest expense for India's middle-class families, who are struggling to keep up, says Ashish Singhal, co-founder of CoinSwitch.

Nvidia now worth nearly as much as India's economy. Details hereAccording to the International Monetary Fund (IMF), India's gross domestic product is currently estimated at $4.2 trillion and is expected to touch $4.27 trillion by the end of 2025.

3 key reasons behind Bitcoin's record high todayAt the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $111,019.74, rising by 2.27% over the past day. The last record was set on May 22 when it briefly touched $111,970. Since then, Bitcoin has had a bumpy ride, but it seems to be back with a bang.

TCS to announce Q1 results today: Here's what to expect from the IT giantTCS Q1 results: Apart from growth numbers, the market will also watch for any announcements on interim dividends, updates on client budgets in sectors like banking, retail, and manufacturing, and comments on the pace of new deal wins.
Sensex opens 85 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; Tata Steel up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 43.60 points to 83,492.48, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.90 points to 25,460.20 as of 9:28 am.

Bitcoin rockets to a record high, just shy of $112,000. Here's whyAs Bitcoin's market cap has crossed into the trillions, more institutional investors are entering the space. Large firms that once stayed away are now taking positions in digital assets, helping push prices higher.

entertainment.headline: Dexter Resurrection OTT release: When and where to watch in IndiaPrime Video will debut the mystery series 'Dexter: Resurrection' in India on July 12, featuring stars like Michael C Hall, Peter Dinklage, and Uma Thurman. It coincides with Amazon's Prime Day celebrations.

Shilpa Shetty steers clear of Marathi row, calls herself a Marathi mulgiShilpa Shetty, embracing her Marathi roots, urged people to avoid controversies over the language debate in Maharashtra. She addressed the row while promoting her upcoming Kannada film 'KD'.
Fans say Hugh Grant looks stylish even while napping at Wimbledon 2025Hugh Grant's outing at Wimbledon 2025 stirred mixed reactions on social media. He was captured nodding off during a match.

Actor Prosenjit clarifies after language remark row: Bengali is language of my lifeBengali superstar Prosenjit Chatterjee addressed the controversy over his remarks about the Bengali language during a Hindi film event, clarifying that his comment was misunderstood and not meant to offend.

The top BTS songs of all time, rankedAs BTS members RM, SUGA, Jin, V, Jungkook, J-Hope, and Jimin gear up for their next chapter, here's a look back at five standout tracks that showcase their range, artistry, and connection with fans. Check if your favourite made the list.

SS Rajamouli announces Baahubali The Epic on 10th anniversary of Prabhas starrerSS Rajamouli announced the release date of 'Baahubali: The Epic'. It will be a two-part combined film which will include both 'Baahubali: The Beginning' and 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion'.

KD teaser: Sanjay Dutt, Dhruva Sarja promise action-packed commercial entertainerDirected by Prem, of 'Jogi' fame, 'KD - The Devil' features an ensemble cast with Dhruva Sarja, Sanjay Dutt, Shilpa Shetty, Reeshma Nanaiah, Ramesh Aravind, Ravichandran and several others. The makers unveiled the film's teaser on July 10.

Bianca Censori's latest look has fans mistaking her for Sabrina Carpenter. PicsBianca Censori and Kanye West have once again set the internet abuzz. This time, following a recent photoshoot, fans are drawing comparisons between the model and pop sensation Sabrina Carpenter.

Munmun Dutta to join Bigg Boss 19? All you need to know about the TV actorMunmun Dutta, known for her role in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', has reportedly been approached for 'Bigg Boss 19'. Though nothing is officially confirmed, her name appears on the tentative list of potential contestants.

Diljit Dosanjh silences No Entry 2 exit rumours with a social media post. WatchDiljit Dosanjh playfully addressed rumours of his exit from 'No Entry 2' by sharing a behind-the-scenes video featuring director Anees Bazmee and producer Boney Kapoor. He dismissed speculation with a humorous voiceover, hinting that he's still very much part of the project.

10 years of Baahubali: How a colloquial title gave Rajamouli pan India blockbusterAs director SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali: The Beginning' marks 10 years, a glimpse into what really led to the pan-India success of the epic action-fantasy. Did the colloquial term in the film's title have a special connection to the Hindi heartland and ancient monks? IndiaToday.in shares insights about the Rajamouli-directorial.

Raj Nidimoru's wife shares golden rules of life after Samantha's new pics with himRaj Nidimoru's wife shared a post on her Instagram stories a day after Samantha dropped new photos from Detroit featuring the director. The speculations about their relationship began a few years back.

Tulsi's return is good news for all. Kyunki saas bhi kabhi viewer thiKyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi, which was the flagship of the K-phenomenon in India, hooked women, saas and bahu alike, for years. Those viewers have been starved of content, with some taking to Pakistani serials, as the OTT-driven entertainment industry moved on to crime and real-life dramas. Tulsi Virani's return is good for viewers, Smriti Irani, who played the protagonist, and the overall content industry.

Chitrangda Singh joins Salman Khan in Battle of GalwanActor Chitrangda Singh is set to star alongside Salman Khan in the upcoming film 'Battle of Galwan,' directed by Apoorva Lakhia. This marks their first collaboration.
Not just a dancer, here's what you didn't know about Raghav JuyalRaghav Juyal has impressed audiences with his versatile talents beyond dance. The actor celebrated his 34th birthday on Thursday.

Dhanush begins filming for Vignesh Raja's D54 with customary puja. PicsNational Award-winning actor Dhanush started shooting for the film 'D54', directed by Vignesh Raja and produced by Vels Film International. The film features music by renowned composer GV Prakash Kumar.

This 20-year-old Tamil composer signs 8 films even before debut releaseA 20-year-old Tamil composer, who kicked off his career as an independent musician, will now compose for eight big Tamils in the South. Among the eight films is Allu Arjun's mega-budget film with director Atlee.

Rashmika Mandanna, Janhvi Kapoor, Mrunal Thakur in Allu Arjun-Atlee's mega AA22xA6Rashmika Mandanna has joined Atlee's giant project featuring Allu Arjun, tentatively titled 'AA22xA6'. The film also features more popular female names, including Deepika Padukone, Janhvi Kapoor and Mrunal Thakur.

Priyanka Chopra chooses hot dog over vada pav, leaves desi fans dividedPriyanka Chopra's recent interview sparked mixed reactions online due to her food preferences. Fans expressed disappointment after she chose hot dogs over vada pav, leading to a flurry of comments and debates.

general news.headline: Manipulated Hindus, threat to national security: ED probes Chhangur BabaAmassed Rs 100-crore assets, manipulated Hindus, threat to national security: ED probes Chhangur Baba

Top court won't pause Bihar voter roll review, asks poll body to consider AadhaarHearing a clutch of petitions challenging the Election Commission's decision, the Supreme Court said the poll watchdog had a mandate under the Constitution to conduct the exercise.
State-level tennis player shot dead by father in GurugramA 25-year-old state-level tennis player was allegedly shot dead by her father in Gurugram, Haryana.

3rd Test, Day 1 Live: Bumrah-Siraj look for breakthroughs after LunchIndia (IND) vs England (ENG), 3rd Test, Day 1 Live Updates: India edged ahead in the opening session at Lord's, with Nitish Kumar Reddy grabbing two big wickets early of the England openers. Joe Root and Ollie Pope are at the crease as England look to make use of great batting conditions.

Wimbledon 2025's best looks came with a side of horological flexWhether it's a vintage Cartier peeking from under a linen cuff or a statement Richard Mille flashing courtside, Wimbledon 2025 is proof that 'timing' is everything, on and off the court.

Semi-finals LIVE: Aryna Sabalenka vs Amanda Anisomova underwayWimbledon semi-finals Live Updates: Aryna Sabalenka will face Amanda Anisimova in a quest for a maiden final berth at the All England Club. Later in the day, Iga Swiatek will be up against Belinda Bencic.

Shashi Tharoor as chief minister? MP shares survey naming him top pick in KeralaShashi Tharoor, whose ties with the Congress have been rocky of late, is preferred by 28.3% of respondents as the UDF's chief ministerial candidate, the survey showed.
'Introducing 'socialist', 'secular' into the Preamble was a deadly sin'Former Delhi High Court judge Justice Shiv Narayan Dhingra (retired) gives his take on the raging debate

Sachin Tendulkar portrait unveiled at Lord's: Artist reveals stunning detailsSachin Tendulkar's portrait was unveiled at Lord's, marking a memorable day for the cricket legend. The artwork was created by Stuart Pearson Wright from a photograph he took at his home 18 years ago.

Deadlock in BJP? Why 7 key states still await elections for chiefsWhile the quorum for the national president's election is complete, the indecision over chiefs in stronghold states reflects factional tensions and strategic uncertainty

Chhangur Baba, conversions and caste-based rate listFrom selling gemstones on a bicycle to amassing Rs 106 crore, Chhangur Baba alias Jalaluddin's rise has been swift and secretive. Chhangur Baba has been accused of converting hundreds of women and receiving foreign funds illegally. He reportedly maintained a caste-based rate list for converting women to Islam, offering up to Rs 16 lakh for Brahmins.

Probe confirms no rising trend in sudden cardiac deaths in Karnataka's HassanA Karnataka government-commissioned inquiry into sudden deaths in Hassan district finds no spike in cardiac fatalities. However, the inquiry report suggested that the death of several young adults signalled a need for stronger preventive action.

Ayurveda's 'Natural Ozempic': The truth about berberine for weight lossThe surrounding buzz is deafening, fuelled by incredible claims of effortless weight loss. But while berberine, or Daru Haldi, has been used for metabolic health, the truth is often more complex than a trendy nickname suggests. Here's what you actually need to know before considering it

How Karnataka plans to get to the heart of cardiac deaths striking the youngThe state advocates stronger screening and mandatory reporting of sudden heart-attack deaths among individuals aged under 45 to tackle the rising public health concern

A young officer, a new father: Story of 2 IAF pilots killed in Rajasthan crashThe pilots, Squadron Leader Lokender Singh Sindhu (31) and Flight Lieutenant Rishi Raj Singh (23), were on a routine training mission when the twin-seater Jaguar crashed in Rajasthan.

Djokovic does 'Pump It Up' dance with kids after sealing 14th Wimbledon semisNovak Djokovic reached his 14th Wimbledon semi-final, but it was his fun 'Pump It Up' dance with his kids after the win that stole the show and melted hearts on Centre Court.

Video: Jaipur man cries after losing phone, frantically looks for it in heavy rainA young man in Jaipur was left heartbroken after his mobile phone slipped into rainwater caused by poor drainage. The emotional incident was captured on video and went viral.

Caught on camera: Trinamool, BJP leaders share drinks in parked car in BengalLocals spotted a private car parked near Apalchand forest for a long time. When they became suspicious and went up to the car occupants, they found them drinking alcohol.

New bridge in Maharashtra becomes skidding zone, closed within hours of openingThe bridge, once promoted as a key solution to traffic congestion in the region, is drawing sharp criticism from opposition and commuters due to loose gravel, muddy patches, cement spills and unevenly laid tar.

4 Chinese arrested in Greece for clicking photos of Rafale jets, facilitiesA high alert was cautioned after the four individuals of Chinese nationality were found photographing sensitive military installations in the area. As per the sources, their actions were deemed suspicious and raised concerns of espionage, as the images they captured reportedly included Rafale fighter jets.

Tulsi Virani's return is good for viewers, Smriti Irani, who played the protagonist, and the overall content industry.

Every year, same problem: Who is to blame for sinking Delhi-NCR after heavy rain?Despite tall claims and early planning, Delhi appears to have been caught off guard yet again. Ironically, monsoon preparations in the city begin nearly six months in advance each year, yet the first major rainfall is enough to throw normal life out of gear.

Sheikh Hasina indicted in Bangladesh over deaths of protesters during stirA three-member panel, headed by Justice Golam Mortuza Mozumder, indicted Sheikh Hasina, former Home Minister Asaduzzaman Khan and former police chief Chowdhury Abdullah Al-Mamun on five charges. Hasina and Khan are being tried in absentia.

Put his hands in my blouse: Malaysian model says priest molested her inside templeA Malaysian model has accused a Hindu priest of sexually assaulting her and placing her hands inside her blouse at a temple under the pretext of giving her blessings.

Shilpa Shetty steers clear of Marathi row, calls herself a Marathi mulgiShilpa Shetty, embracing her Marathi roots, urged people to avoid controversies over the language debate in Maharashtra. She addressed the row while promoting her upcoming Kannada film 'KD'.

SS Rajamouli announces Baahubali The Epic on 10th anniversary of Prabhas starrerSS Rajamouli announced the release date of 'Baahubali: The Epic'. It will be a two-part combined film which will include both 'Baahubali: The Beginning' and 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion'.

sports.headline: Arsenal complete signing of Brentford captain Christian NorgaardArsenal have completed the signing of Brentford captain Christian Norgaard in a bid to shore up their midfield on Thursday, July 10. Norgaard joins Arsenal after spending six seasons at Brentford.

Captain Shubman Gill shines as Nitish Reddy gamble pays off at Lord'sEngland vs India, Lord's Test: Shubman Gill's decision to bring on part-time pacer Nitish Kumar Reddy paid off on Day 1 at Lord's. England lost two wickets in the same over on Thursday.

Semi-finals LIVE: Aryna Sabalenka vs Amanda Anisomova underwayWimbledon semi-finals Live Updates: Aryna Sabalenka will face Amanda Anisimova in a quest for a maiden final berth at the All England Club. Later in the day, Iga Swiatek will be up against Belinda Bencic.

Shubman Gill's choices as captain have been measured: Sachin TendulkarENG vs IND: Sachin Tendulkar heaped praise on Shubman Gill for scoring runs in heaps and making measured choices as the captain of the Indian Test team.

Just happens with me man: Rishabh Pant reacts to his flying bat anticsRishabh Pant commented on his flying bat antics as the Indian vice-captain lost grip of his willow twice during the Edgbaston Test. Pant has been one of the top scorers in the ongoing series against England.

Who is Laurent Mekies? Red Bull boss who replaces Christian Horner?Red Bull shocked the Formula 1 world on July 9 by sacking Christian Horner. Horner, who was at the position for nearly two decades was replaced by Laurent Mekies.

Sachin Tendulkar portrait unveiled at Lord's: Artist reveals stunning detailsSachin Tendulkar's portrait was unveiled at Lord's, marking a memorable day for the cricket legend. The artwork was created by Stuart Pearson Wright from a photograph he took at his home 18 years ago.

Indian football in chaos: Slips from 126 to 133 in latest FIFA rankingsIndia slipped seven places in the latest FIFA world rankings, falling to 133, their worst position since 2017. The drop comes after a poor run of form and the recent departure of head coach Manolo Marquez.

Edgbaston effect? England take rare call to bat 1st under BazballEngland captain Ben Stokes chose to bat first against India at Lord's in a rare move. This was only the second time in 3 years that Stokes won the toss and put England to bat first in home conditions.

Lord's Test: Jasprit Bumrah back after Shubman Gill loses hat-trick of tossesEngland vs India, 3rd Test: Shubman Gill lost the toss in England for the third straight time. Ben Stokes called it right and opted to bat on a bright morning in London. Jasprit Bumrah replacing Prasidh Krishna was the lone change for India.

Sachin Tendulkar portrait unveiled at Lord's: Artist reveals stunning detailsSachin Tendulkar's portrait was unveiled at Lord's, marking a memorable day for the cricket legend. The artwork was created by Stuart Pearson Wright from a photograph he took at his home 18 years ago.

Indian football in chaos: Slips from 126 to 133 in latest FIFA rankingsIndia slipped seven places in the latest FIFA world rankings, falling to 133, their worst position since 2017. The drop comes after a poor run of form and the recent departure of head coach Manolo Marquez.

Edgbaston effect? England take rare call to bat 1st under BazballEngland captain Ben Stokes chose to bat first against India at Lord's in a rare move. This was only the second time in 3 years that Stokes won the toss and put England to bat first in home conditions.

Ben Stokes called it right and opted to bat on a bright morning in London. Jasprit Bumrah replacing Prasidh Krishna was the lone change for India.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
